intro: Libinhania gracilipes, commonly known as the slender-leaved libinhania, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its delicate, elongated leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
